intro: Eritrichium involucratum, commonly known as the woolly mouse-eared cress, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other cruciferous plants. The plant is characterized by its hairy, mat-forming growth and small, yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. It thrives in rocky and arid environments, often found in alpine and subalpine zones. Eritrichium involucratum is known for its ability to tolerate harsh climates and poor soil conditions.
